info.title: Portfolio Reporting Batcher
info.description:
The Portfolio Reporting Batcher (PRB) API allows clients to systematically leverage functionalities of the PRB application. With the initial release, clients can
- trigger existing jobs
- check status of running jobs
- get various details of existing jobs

get.summary: Get details for the given PRB job

403.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

429.description: Rate limit reached. Wait till the time specified in Retry-After header value to make further requests.

500.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting.

503.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in sometime.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.description: The attribute parameter accepts a list of the given enums, separated by commas. Each of them returns the respective data associated with the job. Runs returns the run history of the job.

get.description: Use this endpoint to fetch the documents, tasks, accounts, and/or runs for the PRB job given in the path. Please note jobs with type PD will not return tasks nor accounts so this will be ignored if given as part of the array of attributes in the request.

202.description: Expected response, the job has been accepted, please use /runs/{id}/status to poll status and check progress

403.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

429.description: Rate limit reached. Wait till the time specified in Retry-After header value to make further requests.

500.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting.

503.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in sometime.

post.description: Use this endpoint with with POST method to trigger PRB jobs.

requestBody.description: The main object in the request body contains details for the job to be triggered. The "name" and "type" fields will uniquely identify the job and both must be provided. Other fields can be provided depending on the job's type.

get.summary: check the status for a particular run ID

403.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

404.description: Not Found - runID does not exist

429.description: Rate limit reached. Wait till the time specified in Retry-After header value to make further requests.

500.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting.

503.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in sometime.

get.description: Use this endpoint to check the status of a run using the id from the POST /runs endpoint

delete.description: Use this endpoint with the DELETE method to cancel a specific run

403.description: User is forbidden with current credentials

404.description: Not Found - runID does not exist

409.description: Cannot cancel run, run has already been cancelled, completed, or failed (please see error details for more info)

errors.detail: The job has already completed its execution
errors.title: Failed to process request

errors.detail: There is nothing to cancel as the job has failed
errors.title: Failed to process request

errors.detail: The job has failed to start
errors.title: Failed to process request

errors.detail: The job submission is in progress. Please retry after some time
errors.title: Failed to process request

errors.detail: The job has already been cancelled
errors.title: Failed to process request

429.description: Rate limit reached. Wait till the time specified in Retry-After header value to make further requests.

500.description: Server error. Log the X-DataDirect-Request-Key header to assist in troubleshooting.

503.description: Request timed out. Retry the request in sometime.

additionalProperties.description: An array of the details of the account/s under the task/s in the object key/s

accountsForJob.description: Please note for PI jobs you will only see portfolioId
accountsForJob.title: accountsForJob

accountsForJobAddProp.description: The details of the account under the task in the object key

includeParent.description: Indicates whether or not the parent portfolio is included as a separate portfolio when isSplit is true

isSplit.description: Indicates whether the portfolio's components if any would be treated as individual portfolios when the job is run

latestComponentsOnly.description: When selected, the ACTM/CSTM will be split and will only return components that are still held in the ACTM. I.e., when the end date is "Latest," it will not return components where the end date occurs before Latest.

level.description: The number of levels when isSplit is true that the job will expand down to for a composite portfolio (CSTM or ACTM). "1" means only the first level will be expanded. "all" will be the value if all levels are expanded down.

portfolioId.description: The full file path including portfolio name and type

clientErrorResponse.description: The response schema for reporting errors

documentsForJob.description: Shows the documents for each job where relevant with a collection of tasks under each document
documentsForJob.title: documentsForJob

detail.description: Explanation specific to the occurrence of the error

id.description: Identifier for the error (the Chain ID)

errorSource.description: The pointer and parameter of the error

parameter.description: Indicates which path or URI query parameter caused the error

pointer.description: Pointer to the associated entity in the request body

frequency.description: Used for ADF job types only. Will determine the frequency between the start and end dates.

idStatus.description: Details about the instance of the job run specified via id wrapped in a data object

data.description: Details about the instance of the job run specified via id

jobDetailsResponse.description: Provides the requested details for the specified job and if no attributes are provided, full details will be given

data.description: The main object in the jobDetailsResponse schema

runs.description: An array of information for each run

jobDetailsResponse.title: jobDetailsResponse

jobOverrides.description: If this object is provided, the settings given here will override the default settings of the job for the job run (settings will only be used temporarily and no changes will be made to the default PRB job). Only certain objects can be used for certain job types.

combinations.description: An array of date account combinations

dates.description: Used only for jobs where type is ADF. If using dates override, please provide both start date and end date.

end.description: The end date in format YYYY-MM-DD

start.description: The start date in format YYYY-MM-DD

runAsSerialNumber.description: The FactSet serial number which has the credentials wanted to run the job

tasks.description: Used only for jobs where type is PA

jobOverridesCombinationsRoot.description: Used for Vault job type only. This creates a matrix of given accounts and dates. When the job is run, it will only run for the accounts and dates within this object. (Settings will only be used temporarily and no changes will be made to the default PRB job.)

jobTypes.description: PA - Portfolio Analysis, PUB - Publisher, ADF - Analytics DataFeed, PI - Portfolio Insight, PD - Portfolio Dashboard, vault - Portfolio Vault
jobTypes.title: jobTypes

prbStatus.description: The status of the job as per the application
prbStatus.title: prbStatus

runsForJob.description: Provides full details of when the job has been run

endTime.description: The date and time the job was finished processing

isApiTriggered.description: Indicates whether the job was triggered via the PRB API

runDuration.description: Number of seconds between startTime and endTime

startTime.description: The date and time the job started running after being submitted and potentially waiting in any queue

submitTime.description: The date and time the job was submitted

runsForJob.title: runsForJob

startJob.description: Details required to start a job

jobName.description: The name of the PRB job

startJob.title: startJob

startJobRoot.description: Details required to start the job wrapped in a data object

startJobRunResponse.description: Gives details about the run which was requested wrapped in a data object

data.description: The main object within the startJobRunResponse schema

id.description: The run ID for the job that has been triggered which is used in the /runs/{id}/status endpoint

status.description: The status of the job as per FactSets API standards
status.title: status

statusDescription.description: Further details on the job's status
statusDescription.title: statusDescription

tasksForJob.description: A list of tasks for the given job
tasksForJob.title: tasksForJob

Retry-After.description: Time to wait in seconds before making a new request as the rate limit has reached.

X-FactSet-Api-Request-Key.description: Key to uniquely identify an Analytics API request. Only available after successful authentication.

schema.description: Key to uniquely identify an Analytics API request. Only available after successful authentication.

X-FactSet-Api-RateLimit-Limit.description: Number of allowed requests for the time window.

X-FactSet-Api-RateLimit-Remaining.description: Number of requests left for the time window.

X-FactSet-Api-RateLimit-Reset.description: Number of seconds remaining till rate limit resets.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: These endpoints relate to PRB jobs

tags.name: Runs
tags.description: These endpoints refer to specific runs for a PRB job
